      • removeTaskByName

        public boolean removeTaskByName(java.lang.String taskName)
        Removes task with a given name from the DB.
        Parameters:
        taskName - name of task which you want to remove
        Returns:
        Boolean - true on success and false on failure (failure probably means that there was no such task)

      • saveTask

        public boolean saveTask(Task task)
        This method helps to save tasks in DB - if there's already task with a given name, it updates it. Otherwise - new task is added. It's important, that if you get task from DB and change its name, it still remembers its old name in member variable oldName. It allows to update tasks even if their names were changed.
        Parameters:
        task - task which you want to save
        Returns:
        Boolean - true on success and false on failure
        See Also:
        Task.oldName

      • executeTask

        public boolean executeTask(Task task,
                           long startTime)
        Method starts executing task, which means that it's added to table in DB called ExecutedTasks. You should pass current time (type: long) as the second parameter. It will be stored as a starting time. This method is connected with finishTask(ExecutedTask, long) updateExecutedTask(ExecutedTask)
        Parameters:
        task - task which you want to start executing
        startTime - here you should pass current time
        Returns:
        Boolean - true on success and false on failure
        See Also:
        ExecutedTask

      • updateExecutedTask

        public boolean updateExecutedTask(ExecutedTask task)
        It updates executed task. You should use it to update elapsedTime of the task. Simple example: task.setElapsedTime(elapsedTime); manager.updateExecutedTask(task);}
        Parameters:
        task - ExecutedTask which you want to update
        Returns:
        Boolean - true on success and false on failure

      • finishTask

        public boolean finishTask(ExecutedTask task,
                          long endTime)
        Finishes execution of the task (basically - just sets done flag and its endTime).
        Parameters:
        task - task which you want to finish
        endTime - you should pass current time
        Returns:
        Boolean - true on success and false on failure

        public boolean cleardb()

        public static void main(java.lang.String[] args)
